references.paper_title: The lottery ticket hypothesis: Finding sparse, trainable neural networks
references.reason: This paper introduces the Lottery Ticket Hypothesis, a foundational concept in neural network pruning that heavily inspires the current work's exploration of sparse models.
This paper introduces Neural Ordinary Differential Equations (NODEs), the core deep learning model used in the current work to model gene regulatory dynamics.

references.paper_title: GRAND: a database of gene regulatory network models across human conditions
references.reason: This paper introduces the GRAND database, a crucial resource providing domain knowledge for gene regulatory networks used for training and evaluating the proposed DASH method.

references.paper_title: Differential co-expression-based detection of conditional relationships in transcriptional data: comparative analysis and application to breast cancer
references.reason: This paper provides a key methodology for evaluating inferred gene regulatory networks against gold standard experimental data, a crucial aspect of validating the performance of the proposed DASH method.

references.paper_title: Biologically informed neuralodes for genome-wide regulatory dynamics
references.reason: This paper introduces the PHOENIX model, a state-of-the-art NeuralODE for gene regulatory dynamics, serving as the foundation upon which the proposed DASH method is built.
